p: Computational predictions of the targets of differentially expressed human miRNAs (defined by adjusted p-value < 0.001 and log2 fold-change > 1) were performed using public databases with different algorithms: Diana microT CDS (v.5.0) [ 14, 15], filtering with a threshold of 0.95; TargetScan (v.7.1) [ 16], sorting on a total context score < 0.15; and miRDB (v.5.0) [ 17], with a target threshold > 85. The human miRNAs were also input into public online repositories of experimentally-validated data on molecular interactions: miRecords (release 2013) and miRTarBase (v.7.0) [ 18, 19], set to ‘strong evidence’.
